plot: Nick, Hank and Wu searches for a wesen killer who can liquefy human bones; Hank encounters an old flame.

When a man is found dead with all of the bones in his body seemingly liquefied and removed, Nick and Hank find themselves in the middle of a gruesome family arrangement. Meanwhile, Wu deals with a crisis of his own and Hank reunites with his old flame, Zuri.—NBC

Nick discovers that a strange corpse without bones is one of many cases in Pacific states, all committed on people who were to die anyway by a feral who needs the liquefied bones for his ailing parents. Wu experiences scary nightmares and what he believes to be delusions, but actually has bloody feral episodes. When the team sets a trap, his metamorphosis upsets everything. Adalind rejoins her law firm, Nick waits in vain for her to confess her Hexenbiest powers returned and Black Claw plays its trump card: Diana.—KGF Vissers
